Package com.apt.xdr

Class Xdr

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apt.xdr.Xdr
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RPCXdr
    public class Xdr
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides routines for accessing XDR formated data fields.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int MAX_STRING_LENGTH
      the maximum allowed length of Strings read by readString(java.io.RandomAccessFile)

      • readString

        public static java.lang.String readString​(java.io.RandomAccessFile rafile)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Read an XDR string object from a random access file.
        Parameters:
        rafile - a handle to the XDR file.
        Returns:
        the String or null on error.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on failure.
        See Also:
        MAX_STRING_LENGTH

      • writeString

        public static boolean writeString​(java.io.RandomAccessFile rafile,
                                  java.lang.String outStr,
                                  int maxlen,
                                  boolean pad)
        Write a String object to the file in XDR form.
        Parameters:
        rafile - A handle to the XDR file.
        outStr - The string to write.
        maxlen - The maximum length of the string including the null terminator.
        pad - If true, pad the byte array to maxlen.
        Returns:
        Returns true on success, false on failure.

      • writeString

        public static boolean writeString​(java.io.RandomAccessFile rafile,
                                  java.lang.String outStr,
                                  int maxlen)
        Write a String object to the file in XDR form.
        Parameters:
        rafile - A handle to the XDR file.
        outStr - The string to write.
        maxlen - The maximum length of the byte array to be written to the file.
        Returns:
        Returns true on success, false on failure.

                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Read a float value from a byte array.
        Parameters:
        in - The raw byte stream used for compression.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on failure.

      • writeFloat

        public static boolean writeFloat​(java.io.DataOutputStream s,
                                 float val)
        Write a float value to a byte array in XDR form.
        Parameters:
        s - The raw byte stream used for compression.
        val - The value to write.
        Returns:
        Returns true on success, false on failure.

      • compress

        public static byte[] compress​(byte[] rawArray)
        Compress a byte array.
        Parameters:
        rawArray - The raw byte stream to be compressed.
        Returns:
        The compressed array.

      • expand

        public static byte[] expand​(byte[] cmpArr,
                            int rawLen)
        Expand a byte array.
        Parameters:
        cmpArr - The compressed byte array.
        rawLen - The length of the raw array.
        Returns:
        The expanded array.
